2164.subject: CST
2164.descrlong: Introduces creating 3D characters and environments for games and related media production. Uses of 3D modeling software to create visual assets for use in game production and trailers. Students will create 3D characters and environmental objects, such as landscapes, buildings, manufactured items, from hand renderings. Rigging for game kinematics is also covered. The outcome for the course is a character, skinned, rigged and placed into a fully realized, modeled environment.  (Credit/ No Credit Available)
